topics.body:
This comic is so truthful it hurts.
!http://i0.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/newsfeed/000/952/958/67f.jpg!

If you don't get it anywhere from 300,000 to 500,000 people die a year due to global warming and that's supposed to increase drastically as access to clean water decreases.

By 2030 it's estimated that the combined number of deaths over the years due to climate change will be around 100,000,000 through malnutrition, disease or lack of water.

Side note: California is probably fucked in the long run cause the state is so strapped for water that they're looking at using ocean water and desalination is beyond fucking expensive and it's just not economically feasible for California to become dependent on desalination for water and continue to grow.  Essentially by 2050 the population in the southwest will drastically decrease because people will migrate elsewhere due to incredibly high water cost.

Tl:dr; California, Arizona, New Mexico and Texas in the long run are fucked because of lack of water.
